result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tavell Maurice Wright

records.addlTxt: Defendant's AMENDED Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Tavell Maurice Wright appeared by video.  Attorney Frank Joseph Schiro appeared by video for Tavell Maurice Wright.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. State provides an update to the Court regarding their expert witnesses. Defense counsel requests an adjourned final pre-trial. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
to the Court, filed.

Defendant Tavell Maurice Wright in court with attorney Frank Joseph Schiro and Kristin Leaf.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a final pre-trial. Parties provide an update to the Court. Parties request an adjournment of the jury trial. Court vacates the jury trial on 9/6/22. Court resets final pre-trial and jury trial dates in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Tavell Maurice Wright in court with attorney Frank Joseph Schiro.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for motion hearing. Court placed on the record, findings of fact and legal analysis. For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion to dismiss. Case remains calendared in Branch 29.

Defendant Tavell Maurice Wright in court with attorney Frank Joseph Schiro.  Matthew James Torbenson and Mallory Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held. Parties request a motion hearing on defense's motion. Defense requests a final pre-trial and jury trial. State places offer on the record. Defense rejects the offer. State REVOKES their offer. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's reply to the defendant's motion to dismiss, filed.
Confidential addendum to defendant's motion to dismiss, filed.
to seal, filed.
to dismiss, filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY/BAIL BOND (12 pages) commencing 03-16-2022, by KATHERINE LoCICERO.

Defendant Tavell Maurice Wright in court with attorney Frank Joseph Schiro.  
Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Scheduling conference held.  Atty. Schiro requests a status conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case set for a scheduling conference on 4/27/22 at 1:30 pm. Defense requests an adjournment. Case rescheduled to 5/5/22 at 8:30 am. Parties notified via email.
no VIOLENT contact with L.M.W., L.L.P., and T.M.W. JR, signed and filed.
filed.
Defense requests the no contact order be modified. State does not object. Court GRANTS the request and MODIFIES the no contact order to no VIOLENT contact. State to submit a proposed order.

Defendant Tavell Maurice Wright in court with attorney Frank Joseph Schiro.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tavell Maurice Wright in court with attorney Frank Joseph Schiro.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense requests an adjourned preliminary hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Defense requests the no contact order be modified. State objects. Additional statement made by L.P. Arguments heard. Court takes the motion to modify the no contact order under consideration.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm. DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (02-02-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LMW, LLP, and TMW Jr.

Defendant Tavell Maurice Wright in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defendant indicated that he intends to hire private counsel before the next court date. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/31/22 @ 2:30p
